attributes.action: Regulate the food supply and make 'profiteering in a pandemic' a criminal act.
attributes.background: 1) An emergency policy to regulate the supply of food and other essentials, based on both need and the actual capacity of the supply chain. 2) Recognising 'profiteering in a pandemic' as a serious criminal offence with fines proportionate to its heinous nature, with an accessible means of reporting.
attributes.additional_details: A consistent food supply is the best way to reduce panic & save lives. Most panic buying is by frightened people, who make selfish choices. Yet a subset are profiteering by hoarding essential items, before selling at inflated prices. Undernourished people have weak immune systems; a good diet will help reduce the numbers succumbing to Covid-19. Some supermarkets have voluntary restrictions in place: at a time of pandemic it is lamentable that this policy is not being led by Government.

Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Make it a criminal offence to feed bread to ducks
attributes.background: Make it a criminal offence to feed ducks bread, with fines for people who do this (similar to dog fouling).
attributes.additional_details:
Bread is not a natural source of food for water birds such as ducks. For this reason, it is suitable for them only in very small quantities.
 
Many people in parks are continuing to feed ducks bread. This must stop.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: License grouse moors and repurpose some for rewilding to aid biodiversity
attributes.background:
Implement limited grouse moor licenses, with a zero tolerance license loss for heather burning and predator persecution. 

In areas with many grouse moors or where nature needs more aid, do not issue licenses and repurpose the land for rewilding through the RSPB, Wildlife Trusts, and other parties
attributes.additional_details:
Grouse moors cover over 6 million acres of land in the UK. Intensive management has a massive negative effect on the natural world, disrupting peat bogs which lock up carbon (or emit carbon when drained), deforestation, and killing raptors through cruel methods. They have failed in self regulation.

Introducing a license for England and Wales would force good standards. If these standards not met, the vast amounts of land can be repurposed for rewilding, to meet the 2050 Net Zero target.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about activities relating to grouse moors, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.

It's not sure exactly what you want to be licensed, or how proposals for rewilding would work where a moor is privately owned.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Protect Our Right to Protest
attributes.background: Government and Parliament must oppose the new Police, Crime, Sentencing and Courts Bill that unnecessarily criminalises the publics right to protest. They must instead enforce the Charter For Freedom of Assembly Rights as endorsed by Netpol: https://netpol.org/Charter/
attributes.additional_details:
Government and Parliament must oppose this Bill in all its forms.

They must acknowledge and denounce the authoritarian nature of this Bill, that gives police unjustified power to criminalise any public protest due to its deliberately vague language.

They must acknowledge and denounce the deliberate infringement upon the publics right to protest. As well as the disturbing implications of criminalising protests in support of the rights of protected characteristics under the Equality Act 2010.

rejection.details:
We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Do not restrict our rights to peaceful protest: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/579012

Remove single person protest clauses in Police, Crime, Sentencing & Courts Bill: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/578875

attributes.action: Give local areas the right to protect wild life, green spaces and marine life.

attributes.additional_details:

wildlife, marine life, plants and birds.

rejection.details:
Local authorities already have powers to protect wild life and designate green areas, and have a public authority duty to have regard to conserving biodiversity.

We could accept a petition calling for local authorities to be given new powers, or have new obligations, but it would need to be clear what changes you want to be made to current arrangements.

attributes.action: Enable ANY Endometriosis sufferers with PIP income support & a blue badge.
attributes.background:
Endometriosis sufferers deserve rights to income support and a blue badge. This is, under EVERY circumstance a disabling illness.
The nature of this untreatable long-term condition is that it affects women for their entire lives. This should get the recognition that other disabling illnesses get.
attributes.additional_details:
I believe there is not enough support for Endometriosis sufferers. They live in invisible pain, and deserve the (easily accessible) right to disability benefits. 

The absolute struggle to be taken seriously with this illness is a battle, and women should be supported and listened to more. 

The main aim is: for Endometriosis sufferers to have more access to PIP support and a blue badge, without having to battle with the healthcare system, which has taken years for some women.

rejection.details:
The Personal Independence Payment is paid to people who have a health condition or disability which causes difficulties with daily living or getting around. PIP is paid based on the difficulties causes by a health condition or disability, but there are not particular conditions which result in PIP being paid. You can read more about eligibility for PIP here: https://www.gov.uk/pip/eligibility

Similarly, Blue Badges are automatically awarded to people if they receive certain rates of particular benefits, but are not normally awarded because people have a specific condition. Local councils, not the Government or House of Commons, are responsible for deciding who is eligible for a blue badge.

We have published the following petition, which you might like to sign:

Increase funding for research into Endometriosis and PCOS: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/328570

attributes.action: Additives should have their ingredients shown, not broadly called 'flavourings.'
attributes.background: I would like the broad term words 'flavourings' and 'natural flavourings,' to stop being allowed on ingredients lists, and instead, all the ingredients used in making the additives, provided on the label, so everyone knows exactly what they are eating- it shouldn't be hidden what we're consuming.
attributes.additional_details: Everyone should be made aware of, what they are consuming. By just putting the words 'flavourings,' or 'natural flavourings,' you are hiding what we are putting in our bodies, and not being transparent. Back in the Victorian times, additives were put in bread to make the colour whiter, or the bread seem heavier or thicker, milk also- those were toxic substances- people didn't know then, & don't now. 'Flavourings' are unnatural chemicals, but what chemicals? We have a right to know. Health>profit

attributes.action: Reduce VAT by 10% for 18 months to alleviate the cost of living hike.
attributes.background: Vat is a standard tax paid on many things. It currently stands at 20%. The government should strongly consider reducing this to 10% for a period of 18 months.
attributes.additional_details: In the financial crisis of 2008 VAT was reduced to 15% and it has a positive effect of consumer spending. It had the effect of stimulating the economy and making life a little easier for both business and consumer alike. The same should apply now. The cost of living is now higher than in the last 30 years. Government, by its nature, cannot set prices. But it can cut taxes to help people pay less. A short term cut in VAT would be a huge help to millions of us who are struggling.

attributes.action: Make single-use face masks biodegradable
attributes.background: Change the production of single-use face masks that are available to the general public to make them biodegradable.
attributes.additional_details: Too many facemasks are making their way into our oceans. Not only does this cause catastrophic issues for a wildlife and marine life, tiny microplastic particles make their way into food supply and contaminate human food produce. If even only 1 percent of single use masks were disposed of incorrectly, this would result in 10 million masks per month dispersed in the environment. The weight of each mask is about 4 grams, this results in more than 40 thousand kilograms of plastic in nature.

rejection.details:
The Government is not responsible for the production of face masks, this is a matter for individual producers.

We have accepted the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Ban the sale of disposable face masks to the general public: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/549832

Ban the use of disposable face masks and plastic gloves in public places: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/324857

attributes.action: Ban the use of Palm oil in products on sale in the UK.
attributes.background: I want the Government to ban or significantly reduce the use of products containg Palm oil imported and sold in the UK.
attributes.additional_details:
The effects of deforestation are well documented. 

As consumers we are providing a demand for products containing Palm oil which will and is currently destroying the homes and natural habitats of wildlife. 

The Government can help slow down and possibly prevent the extinction of exotic species by seizing our contribution to the demand of Palm oil which is responsible for killing our wildlife and damaging our planet.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/308368

attributes.action: Make stockpiling PPE law in case of future pandemics.
attributes.background:
The UK government should have a separate, emergency supply of PPE only available for use during pandemics.

The supply should be enough for all people in places of care for a 3 month period.

Stockpile to be reviewed every 5 years.
attributes.additional_details:
In short, not waiting for PPE supplies saves lives.

Pandemics in nature are global, this puts a huge strain on some supply chains which in turn adds delays on much needed PPE to the front line.

We should not be relying on other countries to supply PPE because:

1. A global demand can mean low/slow supply.
2. Other countries may invoke their own version of the "Defense Production Act of 1950" meaning companies that would usually supply materials may no longer be able.

departments.name: Department of Health and Social Care

attributes.action: Introduce driving tests for full licence holders every 10 years.
attributes.background:
Currently a 17yr old can be assessed in 45 minutes if they are safe or not to drive and this licence lasts their lifetime. Nothing is in place to ensure safe driving for life. Too many people lose their life due to reckless driving.

Driving ability should be assessed every 10 yrs.
attributes.additional_details:
I’m a DVSA approved driving instructor and new into this career. It seems fundamentally wrong that a 45 min assessment is enough to gauge safe driving for life. Most people due to human nature pick up bad habits in every skill. Driving is one skill where bad habits have to be eliminated. 

My suggestion is that every 10yrs a full licence holder re-takes their driving test. If they fail, then this is good as they are not safe and hopefully realise the need to fine tune their skills.

attributes.action: Make roadside verges protected wildlife & wildflower habitats for biodiversity

Also, to make it a legal requirement to collect cuttings after mowing
attributes.additional_details:

Inconsiderate maintenance regimes are harming our native wildflowers due to cutting too often & leaving behind those cuttings and cutting at the wrong time harming annual wildflowers, eg.  forgetting how nature can help us with Yellow Rattle.

By affording verges protection nationally, requirements would be placed on local authorities and contractors to maintain for wildflowers & biodiversity.

attributes.action: An adaptation of the Human Rights Act to include freedom from sexual harassment
attributes.background:

This allows citizens to feel as if they have legislation on their side and allows them to speak up and prevents harassment all together. Article 8 is not strong enough - more is deserved.
attributes.additional_details: The new article should say - "All members of the public have the right to freely express who can touch their body or talk to them in a sexual manner. attributes.action: Put David Attenborough on the £50 note for all his work saving the natural world
attributes.background: Give Sir David Attenborough the recognition he truly deserves his efforts to educate the general public on the damage we are causing to the world, his work to save the natural world and being an all round great guy.
attributes.additional_details: Sir David Attenborough has tirelessly worked over many years to bring a better level of harmony between humans and the natural world, more so than possibly anyone has before. His work is recognised by many, across all demographics and you'll be hard pushed to not agree the work he does is of upmost importance. Even in his later years, he is spending all his energy, trying to save the world. Put him on the £50 note and help promote the work he is doing and show it will never be forgotten

rejection.details:
Bank notes are the responsibility of the Bank of England, which is independent of the Government and Parliament.

You can find out how the Bank decides who will be on bank notes here:
https://www.bankofengland.co.uk/banknotes/banknote-characters

attributes.action: Inclusion of a Mental Wellbeing & Emotional Wealth Standalone GCSE in schools
attributes.background: Following the government planning for all pupils to be taught about mental wellbeing, ensuring secondary pupils can spot the signs of common mental illnesses in themselves or others is not enough.  This is reactive and needs to be the psychology of the brain and a proactive Emotional Wealth stance.
attributes.additional_details: We need to equip or children and future leaders with a more proactive approach to Mental Health and Emotional Wellbeing.  Teaching them to understand the way that our emotions and beliefs work.  To better flourish in the world we are living in and societal changes.  This is not reactive and identifying mental health, by then it is too late for many.  We need to teach them to work with the natural composition and responses of the brain, to proactively carve positive conscious thought.

attributes.action: Stop universities being autonomous and for the government to regulate them.
attributes.background: I want the government to regulate the universities as the OIA are not the regulators and can do very little when university are in the wrong. The OFS are the regulators but there is no point in their existence as they do not take on students complaints of a serious nature or in general.
attributes.additional_details: I want the government to intervene by regulating and being involved in the operations and activities of the universities as there is a culture in the sector of racism, inequality and other forms of discrimination. This includes the abuse of academic judgement and powers. Education for all other instituations are regulated by government and there is no legitimate excuse why universities should be exempt to this rule especially given the number of serious cases referred to the OIA.

rejection.details:
We understand that you are concerned about the operation and oversight of universities, but it's not clear exactly what you want the Government to do about this.

Universities are already regulated by the Office for Students. If you are unsatisfied with the OfS you could call on the Government to review or replace the regulator with a new body.

Your petition also refers to wanting the Governemnt to be involved in the operations of universities. If what you want is for the Government to nationalise universities, you could start a petition requesting this, but it would need to be clear this is what you want to happen.

attributes.action: Arrange a day for a nationwide party once covid-19 ceases to exist.
attributes.background: Arrange a day, when safe, for a full day where no one has to work, school, or anything of the similar. Just to celebrate life and our survival in general. I believe we will beat Covid-19, so this belief should be celebrated once it becomes reality.
attributes.additional_details: Because of the mass social distancing measures put in place, the nature of the epidemic, and in some cases the dark side of society expressed, I feel like the nation should have a day to remind ourselves that we as humans can get through anything, and that we are all there for each other in times of harshness and need. The community spirit will need re-invigorating no doubt, and I feel like a day to promote exactly that with disregard to any other social pressure  will do the job just fine.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/304513

attributes.action: Call a General Election Imediately
attributes.background: Call a General Election due to the farcial nature and chaos of the current government.
attributes.additional_details:
The unelected leader and Prime minister has lost all credibilty and authority.  With out a democratic mandate from the British Public, the Tory Party has no right to govern. 

In the interests of the country, we need a general election as soon as possilbe to restore the democratic mandate of the government.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition which calls for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/619781

attributes.action: Make ALL water pollution into ANY body of natrual water a major crime.
attributes.background: All forms of pollution into any natural body of water to be completely OUTLAWED.
attributes.additional_details:
Agricultural and farming waste, industrial waste,  sewage and water company waste,  Livestock waste,  septic tank waste, oil waste.   

No types of waste or byproducts at all should be allowed into waterways, rivers and seas. 

No ifs, no buts, no maybes. 

All enterprises has to be responsible for there own waste. Waterways are a dumping ground.  

We are on the verge of ecological breakdown and unless this stops with we see a human and environmental health crisis of epic proportions.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action. We understand that you're concerned about water pollution, but we're not sure exactly what you want the Government or Parliament to do.

There are already offences for:

- discharging poisonous, noxious or polluting matter or solid waste matter into inland freshwater, coastal waters and relevant territorial waters.

- discharging trade or sewage effluent into inland freshwater, coastal waters and relevant territorial waters.

It's unclear what additional actions you want to be made an offence, or if and how you want penalties for existing offences to be changed.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Excuse survivors of domestic  and sexual violence from jury service for life
attributes.background: For the government to change the laws in regards to jury service so that a survivor of domestic violence or sexual violence, who has been through the court system, is automatically excused for life without the need to apply to the courts.
attributes.additional_details: For survivors, their evidence in court is referred to as the ‘second rape’. This is due to the traumatic nature of having to, not only relive their experiences in court, but face being questioned and challenged over what happened. This is a very traumatic experience and can lead to life long mental health issues. Having to return to court, for any reason, has the potential to be triggering and being back all the emotions and fears of not only being raped but being questioned in court.

attributes.action: Do not stop adequate public funding of the BBC; do not scrap TV license fee.
attributes.background: The Government is proposing to scrap the TV license fee. This will lead to changing the very nature of The BBC. The BBC must remain a publicly funded organisation that serves all of the UK.
attributes.additional_details: The BBC is funded through the TV license fee. The BBC's is not like Netflix or Amazon, or TV channels supported by advertisement. Rather, it offer exceptional value to all audiences, in all parts of the country. It is a fundamental part of British life, identity, and culture. Public funding must continue on an adequate level that must keep up with inflation.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for a similar action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/606445

attributes.action: Ensure mandatory vaccination for all UK parliament members when they return
attributes.background: As the UK parliament members voted on mandatory vaccines for healthcare workers, it is only reasonable for mandatory vaccines to be forced upon the UK parliament members.
attributes.additional_details: Covid-19 and the delta variant is very serious and we need to ensure the continued operation of our UK parliament within this time of very serious emergency. Due to the very serious nature of this emergency all UK parliament members should undergo triple vaccines before they are permitted to continue working. If they decline this they are free to resign.

rejection.details:
We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

All MP's & staff to have Covid19 Vaccine to attend & work at Parliament by law: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/593408

MPs to be tested, vaccinated and wear a mask in order to attend Parliament
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/583052

attributes.action: Make Nature a Religion
attributes.background: Recognise Nature as Religion by 1st November 2021 for COP26
attributes.additional_details: UK is holding COP26 on 1st November 2021.  By recognising Nature as a religion we get to chose how we would like to worship nature and become part of it to help protect it.

rejection.details:
Petitions must call for a specific action that the UK Government or House of Commons is responsible for.

The Government is not responsible for recognising religions. The Equality Act 2010 makes religion or belief a protected characteristic: https://www.equalityhumanrights.com/en/equality-act/protected-characteristics#rob

Determining whether a religion or belief is protected under this legislation is a matter for the courts.

attributes.action: Open outdoor recreational facilities including golf courses once schools return
attributes.background: Allow outdoor recreational facilities to open up once schools return. Golf in particular has demonstrated covid safe procedures and can operate within covid restrictions. Golf is a safe socially distanced sport. When schools return (currently projected 8th March) allow outdoor sports to return yp
attributes.additional_details: Covid safe processes have already seen golf return in tier 4 areas prior to the December lockdown. Golf is a socially distanced sport in natute, the physical and mental health benifits of the sport coupled with the previously implimented covid safe processes have proved golf can operate safely. Economically golf has lost money already but allowing an early return will help economic growth as well as the health benifits. Any outdoor activity proves golf is safe due to the nature of the sport

attributes.action: Issue guidance that birdwatching is a permitted as exercise under lockdown
attributes.background: Ministers to give specific guidance to police, like those for fishing and hunting, on Covid lockdown restrictions, that allow local birdwatching, nature watching and photography as a specifically allowed form of exercise, while adhering to the rules on gathering limits and social distancing
attributes.additional_details:
Department for Digital, Culture, Media & Sport have told the Angling Trust fishing is allowed as exercise so long as participants adhere to the rules on staying local, gathering limits, social distancing & limiting the time spent outdoors
Similar guidance on hunting has also been issued to hunting orgs
Birdwatchers however have been stopped by police & told they are in breach of restrictions for simply stopping to look at wildlife, which is no more a risk than using a gun or sitting with a rod

rejection.details:
Since you started your petition the Government has stated that people can leave their home to exercise or to visit a public outdoor place for outdoor recreation: https://www.gov.uk/guidance/national-lockdown-stay-at-home

The Government's guidance does not specifically refer to particular activities.

attributes.action: Make David Attenboroughs "A Life on Our Planet" mandatory for all U.K. schools.
attributes.background: Due to the current environmental issues facing our planet we believe it should be mandatory for all schools in the U.K. to show David Attenboroughs a life on our planet documentary film. This is so education and knowledge of this crucial issue is available and accessible for the younger generation.
attributes.additional_details: It is the worlds greatest problem and only we have the means to solve it. Global warming and other environmental problems will be the problems of future generations, we believe it is essential for the younger generation to be aware of what is happening to the natural world and what they can do to change it. Therefore we want David Attenboroughs film to be readily available for children in all schools, as it presents a clear message of what we have done to the world and what we can do to save it.

rejection.details:
The educational materials used to teach school students is a matter for individual schools, not the Government or House of Commons.

We have published the following related petition, which you might like to sign:

Introduce a Climate Change subject to the National School Curriculum: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/318835

attributes.action: Longer prison sentences for child sex offenders.
attributes.background: Introduce longer sentences for child sex offenders.  Including online grooming and distribution of images. Any sexual interaction with children under the age of consent.
attributes.additional_details: I am so disheartened and appalled when I see and hear of stories in the news where children have been abused and exploited and the offender is given a light sentence that does not at all reflect the dispicable nature of the crime.

rejection.details:
There are already other petitions about this issue. We cannot accept a new petition when we already have one about a very similar issue.
You are more likely to get action on this issue if you sign and share a single petition.

You may be interested in these petitions:

Set a mandatory custodial sentence for people found guilty of sexual offences 
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/302259

Mandatory life sentences for child sexual abuse 
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/304563

attributes.background:
Divert money from the foreign aid budget to Uk zoo’s during the current covid-19 pandemic.
To help feed the animals.
attributes.additional_details:
Because the uk is not the natural habitat for most of the animals kept in zoo’s,
We have a moral responsibility to look after these animals.

rejection.details: Since you started your petition the Government has announced £100 million rescue package for England’s zoos and aquariums: https://www.gov.uk/government/news/100-million-rescue-package-for-englands-zoos-and-aquariums

attributes.action: Require Electricity Suppliers to actively promote Carbon Intensity awareness
attributes.background: UK Electricity Suppliers should actively promote Carbon Intensity to domestic customers. Simple decisions about when to charge cars and run appliances for all customers including (counter-intuitively) those on green tariffs can help to reduce the risk of running out of natural gas over winter.
attributes.additional_details: Everyone can play a part in collectively reducing the use of fossil fuels by a significant amount. The winter in Europe is likely to bring disruption of supply for electricity/heating when we run low on natural gas. The UK population could make small changes to more closely match electricity demand to supply from renewables generation by observing Carbon Intensity forecasts to reduce this risk. The National Grid, Oxford University and WWF have already developed a web site and an app for this.
